verbs.description: fooster (third-person singular simple present foosters, present participle foostering, simple past and past participle foostered)

entries.meaning: (Ireland, intransitive) To bustle about in a purposeless way; fidget.
examples: "Ony if he wouldn't spind so much time foosthering about with thim little hins, bad luck to thim, that lays an igg no bigger than a marble," she added plaintively, as the trio started down the village street.

entries.meaning: (Ireland, intransitive) To rummage; to engage in inept activity; to noodle.
